means: （宗教团体开办的）旅客招待所

word_mean: 济贫病院：该设施为晚期病人及其家庭直接或通过咨询提供姑息性和支持性治疗

sentence.Network_en: He died in March at St Julia's Hospice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他于3月在圣朱莉娅临终关怀医院去世。

sentence.Network_en: My definition of a good hospice is one where some of the patients start feeling too good to die.
sentence.Network_cn: 我对“好的晚期病人安养院”的定义是一个能让一些病人开始感到生有所恋的地方。

sentence.Network_en: They have started a hospice for terminal patients.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们为身患绝症的病人开办了一个安养所。

临终关怀 (Hospice) — 为患绝症（如癌症或爱滋病）的个人提供临终时的支持关怀。 住院预认证或预注册 (Hospital pre-certification or.

I met Connie the day IT were admitted to the hospice ward , wITe I worked as a volunteer .我在康尼住进收容所病房的那天见到了她。我在那儿当义工。

I've told you before about Florence Stein ( ph ) of South Dakota who was 88 years old and insisted that her daughter bring an absentee ballot to her hospice bedside .我以前曾跟你们讲过来自南达科他州88岁高龄的佛罗伦斯·斯坦太太，她坚持让她的女儿把一张缺席选举人票到她的病床边。
close attention also given to hospice programs , terminal care , and ethical dilemmas in palliative and end-of-life care .密切的注意也被对招待所计画，末端小心和用减轻剂和临终的小心的伦理两难给。
a hospice for travelers or pilgrims .旅客招待所供旅行者或朝圣者住宿的地方

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from French, from Latin hospitium, from hospes, hospit- (see host)

entry.tran: 临终关怀医院;临终安养院
entry.def: A hospice is a special hospital for people who are dying, where their practical and emotional needs are dealt with as well as their medical needs.

example.ex: He died in March at St Julia's Hospice.
example.tran: 他于3月在圣朱莉娅临终关怀医院去世。

means.word_mean: 1. a lodging for travelers (especially one kept by a monastic order)
2. a program of medical and emotional care for the terminally ill

auth_sentence.content: Nothing else beyond his hospice bed concerned him now.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nothing else beyond his hospice bed concerned him now.
